segment.source: title: Epson ESC/POS with formatting
segment.target: title: Epson ESC/POS with formatting

segment.source: description: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.
segment.target: description: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.

segment.source: Epson ESC/POS with formatting
segment.target: Epson ESC/POS with formatting

segment.source: ** Important APIs **
segment.target: ** Important APIs **

segment.source: PointofService Printer
segment.target: PointofService Printer

segment.source: Windows.Devices.PointOfService
segment.target: Windows.Devices.PointOfService

segment.source: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.
segment.target: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.

segment.source: ESC/POS usage
segment.target: ESC/POS usage

segment.source: Windows Point of Service provides use of a variety of printers, including several Epson TM series printers (for a full list of supported printers, see the PointofService Printer page).
segment.target: Windows Point of Service provides use of a variety of printers, including several Epson TM series printers (for a full list of supported printers, see the PointofService Printer page).

segment.source: Windows supports printing through the ESC/POS printer control language, which provides efficient and functional commands for communicating with your printer.
segment.target: Windows supports printing through the ESC/POS printer control language, which provides efficient and functional commands for communicating with your printer.

segment.source: ESC/POS is a command system created by Epson used across a wide range of POS printer systems, aimed at avoiding incompatible command sets by providing universal applicability.
segment.target: ESC/POS is a command system created by Epson used across a wide range of POS printer systems, aimed at avoiding incompatible command sets by providing universal applicability.

segment.source: Most modern printers support ESC/POS.
segment.target: Most modern printers support ESC/POS.

segment.source: All commands start with the ESC character (ASCII 27, HEX 1B) or GS (ASCII 29, HEX 1D), followed by another character that specifies the command.
segment.target: All commands start with the ESC character (ASCII 27, HEX 1B) or GS (ASCII 29, HEX 1D), followed by another character that specifies the command.

segment.source: Normal text is simply sent to the printer, separated by line breaks.
segment.target: Normal text is simply sent to the printer, separated by line breaks.

segment.source: The Windows PointOfService API provides much of that functionality for you via the Print() or PrintLine() methods.
segment.target: The Windows PointOfService API provides much of that functionality for you via the Print() or PrintLine() methods.

segment.source: However, to get certain formatting or to send specific commands, you must use ESC/POS commands, built as a string and sent to the printer.
segment.target: However, to get certain formatting or to send specific commands, you must use ESC/POS commands, built as a string and sent to the printer.

segment.source: Example using bold and double size characters
segment.target: Example using bold and double size characters

segment.source: The example below shows how to use ESC/POS commands to print in bold and double sized characters.
segment.target: The example below shows how to use ESC/POS commands to print in bold and double sized characters.

segment.source: Note that each command is built as a string, then inserted into the printJob calls.
segment.target: Note that each command is built as a string, then inserted into the printJob calls.

segment.source: For more information on ESC/POS, including available commands, check out the Epson ESC/POS FAQ.
segment.target: For more information on ESC/POS, including available commands, check out the Epson ESC/POS FAQ.

segment.source: For details on Windows.Devices.PointOfService and all the available functionality, see PointofService Printer on MSDN.
segment.target: For details on Windows.Devices.PointOfService and all the available functionality, see PointofService Printer on MSDN.
